sentences: Meil on tänal õhtusöögile kaks külalist.
context: The word 'õhtusöögile' is an Estonian noun phrase meaning 'to dinner' or 'for dinner'. It consists of 'õhtu-' (evening) + 'söök' (meal/food) + '-le' (a directional case ending indicating movement towards). This is the illative case form used to indicate motion toward a destination - in this case, going to have an evening meal. The word implies the purpose of the action is to attend or participate in dinner.
